perturbation.original_text: "We are excited about the  opportunities  available to us as a result of our new partnership  with BISYS," stated Thomas C. Gregor,  chairman and chief executive officer of United National.  "During the past year we completed an assessment of our  information  processing  needs going forward into the next  century.  After evaluating a number of different options, we determined that the flexibility and quality of BISYS'  TOTALPLUS (R) system would best serve our needs today and for years to come."
perturbation.changed_text: "We are excited about the  opportunities  available to us as a result of our new partnership  with BISYS," stated Thomas C. Gregor,  chairman and chief executive officer of United National. "After evaluating a number of different options, we determined that the flexibility and quality of BISYS'  TOTALPLUS (R) system would best serve our needs today and for years to come."
perturbation.explanation: By removing the sentence "During the past year we completed an assessment of our information processing needs going forward into the next century," we omit information about the due diligence process. Although this might seem minor, depending on the services BISYS is providing (e.g., handling customer data), regulations like the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) in the United States require financial institutions to conduct thorough risk assessments and due diligence when outsourcing critical functions. Omitting this statement could imply a lack of due diligence, creating regulatory risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) - potentially related to vendor due diligence requirements for outsourced services.

perturbation.original_text: "United Financial  Services, a third party services provider that United National Bancorp owns with another joint venture  partner,  currently handles the Bank's information  processing  services,  item processing and deposit  services.  As a result of its planned move to BISYS,  United  National will be  liquidating  its interest  in United  Financial  Services  during the first half of 1999 after it goes live with BISYS."
perturbation.changed_text: "United Financial  Services currently handles the Bank's information  processing  services,  item processing and deposit  services.  As a result of its planned move to BISYS,  United  National will be  liquidating  its interest  in United  Financial  Services  during the first half of 1999 after it goes live with BISYS."
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase "a third party services provider that United National Bancorp owns with another joint venture partner," we conceal a related party relationship. Regulations like Section 23A and 23B of the Federal Reserve Act in the United States impose restrictions on transactions between banks and their affiliates to prevent self-dealing and protect the bank's financial stability. Omitting the affiliate relationship creates the potential for non-compliance, if the arrangement is not at arm's length.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 23A and 23B of the Federal Reserve Act - related party transaction rules.
